page.title: 20An Edlington Councillor.
page.content: Mrs.Katherine"Kitty"Bower O.B.E.is a local councillor for the town council of Edlington,an elected member of Doncaster M.B.C.& a J.P.She was born & has lived her life in the village.She is proud to identify with the mining people;a close-knit community."Working with mutual concern underground is carried to the surface".In the week of our interview she had Council,Social Services,Labour Women's,British Legion & Miner's Welfare meetings.As a child she can recall her father canvassing for the Yorkshire Miner's Association (6d:men,3d:lads)and later in the'26 Strike police billeted in the St. John's Drill Hall.Belonging to the W.V.S during the War,she welcolmed evacuees from London,Leeds & Hull.Post War a new plastics factory brought vital work to the village.Today she sees it's mining identity threatened.
